page.title: 04HOUSING ON JOHNSON FOLD
page.content: Johnson Fold Estate is a council estate built in the 1950's on the northern edge of Bolton's residential area.It is comprised of terraced and semi-detached houses with a few bungalows for the elderly.They are two or three bedroomed houses with lounge, kitchen and bathrooms heated by gas, electric or coal fires.Most of the property is rented with about 10% of families following the present trend of buying their houses.The estate is undergoing an extensive renovation project.All the houses are being electrically re-wired and are being fitted with wall insulation.Some houses are being re-fitted with doors and window frames and are having electrical central heating installed.
